Mr. X. receives all used tokens and thus it becomes easier for him to travel throughout the game. But as a clue to the other players he must show which token he uses each turn. Mr. X. has a limited number of black tokens which could stand for any means of transportation. At five specific times during the game, Mr. X. has to reveal his current position. The detectives win when they land on the same square as Mr. X. Mr. X. wins when all tokens are spend up.

This digital conversion features photographs and digital animations of London. The game can be played with up to six players and both Mr. X. and the detectives can be A.I. controlled.

Games.Name: Secret Mission
Games.Overview: It's the 1950's. The place is the Indo-Chinese country of Opalia. Opalia has become the target of the USSR and the United States and its geographic position has made it a real hot spot in the Cold War battle of the superpowers. Networks of underground informants and foreign spies have totally destabilized this once peaceful country and local rebels, led by the devious Prime Minister, Vishaka, are trying to topple the king. The safety of Opalia is in your hands alone... you can't let them down!

Games.Name: Shadoan
Games.Overview:
This is the sequel to Kingdom: The Far Reaches. Many years ago, the wise Mobus broke a powerful amulet called "The Hand" in 5 pieces in order to protect it from getting into the hands of his evil brother Torlock. These pieces were sent to the far corners of the land. As the young Prince Lathan Kandor you have already retrieved the Black Mace, the Hunting Horn and the Orb of Mobus (in the previous game). Now you must retrieve the final 2 pieces (the Dagger of Arne and the Crown of Malric), defeat evil and be reunited with Princess Grace Delight.

This is an adventure from the makers of Dragon's Lair. The plot isn't exactly original or complex, but the animation is fluid and well-drawn. Gameplay is about using the right item or making the correct choice between the animated sequences; some of these choices are timed, meaning that you can lose health or even die, but there are plenty of opportunities to replenish your health. Of special note is the ever-present Disney-like music.

Games.Name: Shaolin's Road
Games.Overview:
Shaolin's Road is a action adventure that takes place in medieval China. When Tsu Yu's father, a powerful warlord, is murdered and his sword stolen, Tsu Yu vows to avenge his father's murder. The player (as Tsu Yu) will have to learn Shaolin Kung Fu to do so. 

The player has to roam the land and speak with other Kung Fu heroes, who will most likely only scoff at the player. Occasionally they will send the player on a trial which comes in the form of a mini game, such as shooting a snake with a bow and arrow, engaging in Kung Fu fighting and karate, throwing stars, performing calligraphy and playing memory to learn Chinese symbols. 

Completing challenges changes the color of the player's belt and gives him more recognition with the other fighters allowing him to progress further. It also unlocks new pieces of the map you can use to travel to new areas.

Games.Name: Shipwreck
Games.Overview:
Shipwreck is an educational title about electricity and magnetism for children of 8 years and older. In this game children learn the principles, terms and practical applications of electricity. The game is based on the educational children's books by Two-Can Publishing.

In the main game the player is shipwrecked on an island and has to repair a broken motorboat in order to escape from the evil clutches of "Ohm". The player will have to put all his knowledge of electricity to good use to succeed.

Games.Name: Solar Crusade
Games.Overview:
Solar Crusade is an on-rails FMV shoot 'em up designed and published by Infogrames Multimedia, created using Softimage 3D, and modeled on Silicon Graphics workstations hardware for the Windows 95 operating system and Phillips CD-i video game console.

It was the last game released for the Cd-i.

Games.Name: Soundtrap
Games.Overview:
Soundtrap is an educational title about sound for children of 8 years and older. In this game children learn the principles, terms and practical applications of sound. The game is based on the educational children's books by Two-Can Publishing.

After a series of interactive lessons, the player can have a go at the main game: An adventure game in which the player has to apply his knew knowledge to the test.

Games.Name: Space Ace
Games.Overview: The evil commander Borf has kidnapped Ace's girlfriend, the beautiful Kimberly, and is plotting to enslave the Earth using his dreaded "Infanto Ray", a weapon that changes everyone it blasts into a helpless baby. Armed with only a laser gun, Ace must find and destroy the Infanto Ray, rescue Kimberly and save the Earth. All in a day's work for a superhero, right? Featuring full screen animation and crisp, powerful sound from the original laser disc arcade classic, Space Ace delivers arcade action at its most addictive!

Games.Name: Space Ranger: Return to Earth
Games.Overview: Space Ranger: Return to Earth is an Action game, developed by Studio Interactive and published by Older Games, which was released in 2002.

Games.Name: Sport Freaks
Games.Overview: Sport Freaks is a sports quiz game based on a Dutch television game show of the same name. The game includes all the questions that were written for the show but were never used. All the questions relate to a selection of 45 sports in 50 countries since the year 1900. The number of questions in the game (1250) equals 60 game show episodes. Using a sort of slot machine each turn a sport, year and country is chosen which you receive a question about. The emphasis lies on Dutch sports history.

Games.Name: Steel Machine
Games.Overview: Your mission is to destroy 6 enormous battle cruisers to save the planet. You have 15 days to destroy the ships before they reach your planet. If they do, the consequences will be disastrous. Your prototype ship has been developed and its name is "Steel Machine". You will have to find a way to destroy the main reactors of each battle cruiser, by destroying the main reactor the ship will destabilise causing the cruiser to blow up. The cruisers have lots of enemy defences to be destroyed. The game is a horizontal shoot'em-up based on the old Commodore 64 game Uridium by Andrew Braybrook. It is one of the first CDi game titles which fully uses the hardware. Controlling the Steel Machine is quite simple.

Games.Name: Stickybear Math
Games.Overview:
Now kids can practice basic math skills and help the Stickybear family out of some sticky jams at the same time. It's simple - for every set of addition and subtraction problems youngsters get right, Stickybear gets a step closer to getting out of a jam.

Get enough problems right and Stickybear gets out of one jam... but into another...

And kids practice skills at a pace that's just right for them... because Stickybear Math, the computer automatically advances when the child is ready to try another skill level. Adults can choose a child's starting level. So, horizontal or vertical problems, single-digit or four-digit, carrying or borrowing, kids are ready for them!

Games.Name: Stickybear Preschool
Games.Overview: Stickybear: Preschool is an educational title for children ages three through six, based on Richard Hefter's Stickybear character. In this game players learn and improve basic skills such as recognizing shapes or opposites, learning the alphabet and counting and grouping items and colors. Each of the simple games is accompanied with cartoon animations and sound effects of Stickybear and his friends. The game is bilingual in English and Spanish.

Games.Name: Stickybear Reading
Games.Overview:
Stickybear: Reading is an educational title for children ages four to eight, based on Richard Hefter's Stickybear character. The game features three different reading activities, all accompanied with cartoon animations, music and comical sound effects.

Using the Sentence Builder players can create their own sentences from nouns and verbs, which will be read out loud by Stickybear. Each sentence features an animation. In Sarah's Word Book players can click on items which then animate, their names are said and displayed textually. Finally in Word Bop, players use a magical cannon that turns items into words and vice versa. The game features both the English and Spanish language to play in.

Games.Name: Story Machine: Star Dreams
Games.Overview: Galaxis leads you into an intergalactic adventure that you design yourself. On this journey it is up to your imagination whether your stories are strange, ghostly or funny.

Games.Name: Striker Pro
Games.Overview: Striker Pro is a soccer game for the CD-i. The game has a top-down view with the goals at the top and bottom of the playing field. In the game you can choose from 64 national teams to play with. There are various game modes such as friendly, world league and world cup. Optionally the game can be played in a 6 vs 6 mode. The game can be played against the AI or another player.

Games.Name: Strip Poker Live
Games.Overview:
Strip Poker Live is a strip poker game. There are six women to play against: a Swedish blonde, a Mediterranean brunette, a Maui, a Parisian and an athletic girl. 

Like most strip poker games you play poker against the AI and as you are winning the opponent will gradually lose pieces of clothing.

Games.Name: Strip Poker Pro
Games.Overview: Strip-Poker Pro is a typical game of strip poker. You play the game of poker, but for each hand lost a player loses a piece of clothing. There are five computer opponents; three women and two men. Each of the computer opponents is displayed in full motion video.

Games.Name: Super Mario's Wacky Worlds
Games.Overview: Super Mario's Wacky Worlds is a canceled Mario platform video game developed by NovaLogic for the Philips CD-i system. The game was conceived as a sequel to Super Mario World

Games.Name: Surf City
Games.Overview:
Surf City is an interactive musical with songs from the Beach Boys. 

In the game the player is presented with an overview map of the beach town aptly named Surf City. The player can click on various streets, which triggers a scene where the street scrolls by and the player can click on the various buildings he wants to visit. Inside the building the player can talk to people and interact with items. The scenes are accompanied with Beach Boys music from the 60s and help tell the story of the main characters of the game.

There's various games and activities to be played as well such as:
Build a hot rod
Go bowling at the Beach Bowl
Design a surfboard
Play the video jukebox
Race cars at the arcade speedway
Take a pizza order
Learn surf lingo from Tiki
Visit the love teller
Take a pop quiz at the high school
Watch fireworks on the pier
Order a burger-to-go
Play spin-the-bottle at Wendy's house

Games.Name: Tangram: The Ultimate Chinese Game
Games.Overview: CD-I makes Tangram more challenging, more exciting. There are more symbols, more silhouettes, so you can develop greater skills. Just use the cursor to rotate and move the pieces. Choose free expression or tackle set tasks. And choose your own level of play: beginner, intermediate, advanced, expert - up to the highest level of all. Free Form Tangram on CD-I means moving forms, mood music, and much more fun!

Games.Name: Tell Me Why One
Games.Overview: Tell Me Why One is an interactive trivia game. There are over 175 questions that need answering. Questions in the game are typical questions that curious children might ask. They come in five categories: our world, how things work, the zoo, how things began and the human body. Questions are supported with audio and visuals. The game comes with over 3 hours of fact filled presentations and interactive exhibits.

Games.Name: Tell Me Why Two
Games.Overview: Tell Me Why Two is an interactive trivia game and sequel to Tell Me Why One. The game comes with an additional 175+ questions that need answering. Questions in the game are typical questions that curious children might ask. They come in five categories: our world, how things work, the zoo, how things began and the human body. Questions are supported with audio and visuals. The game comes with over 3 hours of fact filled presentations and interactive exhibits.

Games.Name: Tetris
Games.Overview:
Tetris... a classic game in a class of its own. Originally conceived by Alexey Pazhitnov and designed by Vadim Gerasimov of the former USSR, Tetris is recognized all over the world for its elegant simplicity and challenging game play.

Tetris CD-i is the ultimate Tetris experience. Spectacular video nature scenes and an original CD score by Jim Andron complement classic Tetris game play and elevate this phenomenon to new heights. In CD-i, the classic becomes a legend.

You-ll find Tetris CD-i irresistibly addicting as you try to rotate and flip moving pieces to fit into a solid line at the bottom of the playing field. Remove ten lines and you move on to the next level! Discover what game players all over the world have learned...this is one addiction you can't live without.

- Original Tetris Game Play features
- Ten levels of play
- Spectacular motion video nature backgrounds
- Ten original CD soundtracks

Games.Name: Tetsuo Gaiden
Games.Overview:
Tetsuo Gaiden, a fantasy flight through the realms of alien darkness. Featuring the best CD-i has got to offer; amazing 3D full motion video, riveting gameplay and a smack in your face soundtrack...

Prepare for more than 80 blazing levels filled with the best and fastest gameplay ever created on CD-i. Brought to you by the award-winning team from Christmas Country, Tetsuo Gaiden is jampacked with nice features like bonus items, multiple laser fire, smartbombs, energy shields and super bonusses.

Get ready for the best game of spring '97.

Games.Name: Text Tiles
Games.Overview: Text Tiles is a strategic puzzle game in which players have to spell words. Using a set of given letters the players have to form words, much like Scrabble. This is done on a 12x12 board. The letters can be used to either form a long word or multiple short words. Points are scored for each correct word. Letters are received one at a time and disappear again after a certain amount of time creating a time pressure for forming words. The player can see what his next letter is going to be so he can plan ahead. The game can be played with up to four players.

Games.Name: The 7th Guest
Games.Overview: A stunning interactive drama of mystery and intrigue... You don't know why you're in the mansion of the long-gone master toy maker, but you do know that you're not alone... The 7th Guest on CD-i promises to keep you on the edge of your seat with a combination of vivid imagery, special effects and cinematic shocks. The 7th Guest on CD-i features CD-i Digital Video, terrifyingly real virtual environments, haunted rooms to explore - complete with live actors - bizarre puzzles to solve, games to play and a chilling soundtrack.

Games.Name: The Apprentice
Games.Overview: Poor Marvin needs your help! As apprentice to the great wizard Gandorf S. Wandburner III, Marvin must perform treacherous tasks throughout the castle towers. Take control of the apprentice and guide him through six heart-stopping levels in the arcade-style platform game that delivers fast, furious play with thousands of frames of animation. You'll be running, jumping, flying, even swimming your way around the towers, working against the clock and all the beastly enemies who are eager to prove that a wizard's work is never done!

Games.Name: The Concise Oxford Dictionary & Oxford Thesaurus
Games.Overview: Features Dictionary Facts and Fiction game

Games.Name: The Crayon Factory
Games.Overview:
The Crayon Factory is an educational children's game for ages 3 through 7. In the game players explore the Crayon Factory and have fun and learn along the way.

Players can enjoy a virtual tour of the factory narrated by Shari Lewis (Isa Hoes for the Dutch version), but this tour can also be skipped to jump right into the interactive mode. Here players can play games such as repairing pipes or gears. This game focuses on puzzle solving, pattern recognition, spatial rotation and hand-eye coordination.

Another game requires the player to fill packages with one crayon of each colour. In the quality control game players have to inspect boxes with a magnifying glass to check for colour patterns.

Players can also mix colours and learn how secondary colours are created.

With each game the players can achieve expert status. This is usually when performing the task correctly for a large number of times. When the expert status is reached a parent can print out a certificate.

In addition to the games there are 34 drawings to colour either ingame or after printing.

Games.Name: The Dark Fables of Aesop
Games.Overview: The Dark Fables of Aesop is a collection of twelve fables from Æsop (Greece, 620-560 BC). The stories are presented with illustrations, animations and Jazz music. Included with the disk are 60 maze games with three different difficulties.

Games.Name: The Joker's Wild
Games.Overview:
The Joker's Wild! is a trivia game based on the 70-80s game show of the same name. The game is hosted by Wink Martindale.

In the game players answer multiple choice questions stated by the host. Categories for the questions are determined by a giant slot machine with three wheels. Each wheel features five categories and a joker. Each round a player pulls the lever and picks one of the resulting categories. The joker counts as a wild card.

When an answer is correctly given to a question the player receives a certain amount of money. If the category is shown on the slot machine two or three times (2 or 3 of a kind) the scores are multiplied. When a player answers incorrectly his opponent may give a shot at the question and steal the money.

Unlike the original show this video game adaptation can be played with up to four players. Of course no money can be won with this video game, but there is a high score list that keeps track of all the best scores.

Games.Name: The Joker's Wild Jr
Games.Overview:
The Joker's Wild Jr. is a trivia game based on the 70-80s game show The Joker's Wild. The game is hosted by Marc Summers.

Gameplay is the same as for the adult version The Joker's Wild. In the game players answer multiple choice questions stated by the host. Categories for the questions are determined by a giant slot machine with three wheels. Each wheel features five categories and a joker. Each round a player pulls the lever and picks one of the resulting categories. The joker counts as a wild card.

When an answer is correctly given to a question the player receives a certain amount of money. If the category is shown on the slot machine two or three times (2 or 3 of a kind) the scores are multiplied. When a player answers incorrectly his opponent may give a shot at the question and steal the money.

Unlike the original show this video game adaptation can be played with up to four players. Of course no money can be won with this video game, but there is a high score list that keeps track of all the best scores. Major differences with the adult version are the change of host, easier questions and some more children friendly graphics.

Games.Name: The Last Bounty Hunter
Games.Overview: As a Bounty Hunter, you will be equipped with a six-shooter and sometimes a shotgun. Careful, one of the gunfighters that protects the four outlaws is renowned fast draw world champion Wes Flowers. The pursuit of each outlaw will take you through different shootout scenarios and challenges. Plus, the order in which you stalk each outlaw will change the play action responses and difficulty level making for a different game each time you play!

Games.Name: The Lost Ride
Games.Overview: The Lost Ride is a rail shooter game where you are literally on rails. The player is put inside a futuristic roller coaster and has to shoot anything that might get in his way. The game comes with three different themes for its levels: Mine World, Aqua World and Future World. Each world has different seamless prerendered 3D backgrounds that feature as backdrops for the shooting action. At the end of each stage a Boss creature has to be killed, which will unlock a bonus ride. These random generated tracks are maze-like and require you to choose a direction at various points. They are presented in surround sound so they really feel like being inside a roller coaster.

Games.Name: The Ultimate Noah's Ark
Games.Overview:
The Ultimate Noah's Ark is a digital version of the picture-book of the same name by artist Mike Wilks. Like the book the player is presented with a large drawing of Noah's Ark. On the Ark are 354 different animal species to be found. All but one of them have a mate. It's up to the user to find which animal is missing his mate.

The original drawing can be broken up into 256 different screen-wide detail close-ups. In addition to the drawing this software title comes with additional information for all the animals including videos of them in their natural habitats.

Games.Name: The Wacky World of Miniature Golf - with Eugene Levy
Games.Overview:
In The Wacky World of Miniature Golf, the player can pick from a bevy of cartoon golfers and compete in 18 holes of miniature putt-putt golf in a variety of cartoon fantasy settings such as Egypt, prehistoric times, Atlantis, a prison and many more. The gameplay is more of an interactive cartoon where the player chooses the direction they wish to hit the ball and pressing the action button. If the player has chosen correctly they will hit it successfully and be treated to a cutscene where the ball will avoid the various obstacles and landing in the hole. Choosing the wrong path, however, will have their ball destroyed by a variety of obstacles and force the player to retry again.

A feature of the game is the voice acting talent of Eugene Levy who is most notable for his film appearances in the American Pie film series.

Games.Name: Thumbelina
Games.Overview:
Thumbelina is an interactive telling of the story by Hans Christian Andersen. It features video fragments and stills from the cartoon film by Don Bluth. As the story is told images are show in the background. Many of these images include activities. These activities include coloring, starting animations through clicking on hot-spots and simple puzzles like counting objects and moving shapes to the correct sockets with the cursor.

Colored images start to animate once they are filled in. The whole story is divided into seven chapters, so that it is possible to skip to the activities you want to play, or continue the story at a different time.

Games.Name: Thunder in Paradise
Games.Overview: Here's your shot at Paradise, bro. You're in the middle of an action-packed adventure with your cohorts Spence (Terry "Hulk" Hogan) and Bru (Chris Lemmon). Blast your way through these mind-blowing action encounters as you attempt to rescue Spence's daughter Jessica, regain control of the M.A.J.O.R., and crush your arch enemy, RAMPIKE! Race at hyperspeed through the Caribbean, aboard THUNDER, a 45-foot piece of hi-tech marine hardware. Take control of the boat's weapon systems and defend THUNDER from a shower of deadly threats. Face down minions of the psychotic RAMPIKE on the eerie trails of Rossiter's Island. Go toe-to-toe with the M.A.J.O.R., a bio-humanoid gone haywire, in a battle for Jessica's life!

Games.Name: Tic Tac Toe
Games.Overview: Tic Tac Toe is a basic implementation of original paper and pencil version. The player may compete only with computer. The game is entirely keyboard controlled by pressing 1-9 buttons, assigned to one field on the board.

Games.Name: Tim & Bear at the Airport
Games.Overview:
Unlike the first title in the series which didn't feature interaction (beyond choosing which of the two characters to follow), this second Tim & Beer title is fully interactive.

Tim and his teddy bear are visiting their cousin Tina who lives far away. Because of this they have to go by plane. Of course it's not easy to navigate around an airport.

Tim & Bear at the Airport is an interactive cartoon film in which the viewer watches Tim & Beer explore the airport and the airplane. Viewers can opt to let the cartoon roll, or at times interfere and tell Tim or Bear what to do by choosing from several preset options. This creates tiny differences in how the story progresses.

Games.Name: Titanic: An Interactive Exploration
Games.Overview: Titanic: An Interactive Exploration was essentially an interactive documentary released for Phillip's illfated CDI platform.

Games.Name: Tom: Magic Picture Show
Games.Overview:
Tom: Magic Picture Show is an educational game for children ages 2 and up. In the game they can learn English, French or German through a variety of activities.

Activities include various puzzle games and a coloring book. The whole game is accompanied with a soundtrack.

Games.Name: Ultra CDi Soccer
Games.Overview: Ultra CD-i Soccer is a top-down soccer game. The game features 72 European teams to play with against the computer or a friend. The game allows the player to play a total competition with all the teams, and to create his own competition with up to four teams.

Games.Name: Uncover: Featuring Tatjanna
Games.Overview: Uncover featuring Tatjana is a strategic action game featuring Croatian-Dutch model, actor and singer Tatjana Simić. The game is similar to the arcade game Qix. Play takes place on a rectangular playing field. The player has to draw lines in order to colour in parts of the field. An erratically moving enemy moves around the playing field, but can only harm the player when he's drawing lines. When the player is not drawing lines he can only move on the outer borders of the playing field. There are also enemies on these borders moving in clockwise or counterclockwise directions. When the player touches an enemy the player loses a life. Unlike the original where the player also loses a life when the erratic enemy touches an incomplete shape, he now chases the player along the line. Coloured in parts in this version of the game are parts of pictures of Tatjana.

Games.Name: Urban Murderfiles - Episode 1: New York City
Vegas Girls
Games.Overview: Vegas Girls offers the players to play all kinds of casino games such as roulette, blackjack, poker, dice and slot machines. Each of the games is played using the familiar rules of the games, but in strip-poker style. This means the player plays against a virtual female who will lose a piece of clothing every time the player wins. There are various girls to play against.

Games.Name: Video Speedway: The Ultimate Racing Experience
Games.Overview: Video Speedway is a racing game for the CD-i. The game is presented in a first person view from inside the fictional Formula One racing cars. Before each race the player has to run a trial lap on the track. Different tracks have different backgrounds such as the sky lines of New York, Paris, Geneva, Monument Valley and London.

Games.Name: Voyeur
Games.Overview:
Like To Watch?

You'll get an eye-full as you peer into your neighbors' sordid lives in the wickedly seductive interactive mystery, Voyeur. Political blackmail... murder... seductive intrigue... you'll see it all. But will you only watch - hidden like a true voyeur - or will you step into the drama and try to prevent a murder?

Voyeur combines dramatic game play with chilling suspense and erotic undertones guaranteed to keep your excitement level up. Hollywood actors, excellent film quality and an alluring storyline make this a sizzling thriller that will bring our the voyeur in everyone. Come on. We know you want to watch.

Games.Name: Voyeur II
Games.Overview: Voyeur II is the sequel to the game Voyeur made by Philips Media and Interweave Entertainment made only for MS-DOS and Windows 3.1 PC's and released in 1996 starring Dennis Weaver.

Games.Name: Whack A Bubble
Games.Overview:
Whack a Bubble is a paddle and ball game in the vein of Breakout. You control a paddle at the bottom of the screen and have to remove bubbles at the top by bouncing a ball against them. If the ball leaves the screen at the bottom you loose a life.

The game comes with a 100 levels and 3 difficulties. The game also features a two player mode where players play against each other.

Games.Name: Who Shot Johnny Rock?
Games.Overview: It's the rollicking 30's and someone has killed popular singer Johnny Rock in this action-packed gangster whodunit. The player will need to navigate the back streets, gaming halls, funeral parlors and the dirty sections of this city to get at the clues held by a number of shady characters and solve this murder mystery. Bad guys with machine guns provide a high level of shooting action.

Games.Name: Wimbledon Challenge: The Official Wimbledon Quiz Game
Wordplay
Games.Overview: Wordplay is a word game for up to four players. The virtual host Bob continuously presents new letters in a pool. Players select a letter to place in their own collection each turn. It is up to the players to create words with their collected letters. Forming words scores the players points, the first player to reach 200 points wins the match. Players score more points for words that use all of their letters. If a player can't make any words from the letters in the pool he or she can opt to reshuffle it completely but losing a turn. The game recognizes 35,000 words of both British and American spelling.

Games.Name: World Cup Golf: Hyatt Dorado Beach
Games.Overview:
World Cup Golf takes the player to Puerto Rico's own Hyatt Dorado Beach Golf Course as they can choose from a bevy of fictional golfers or create their own in 18 rounds of golf. There are 15 types of tournaments to choose from including skins, medal and stableford to name a few. Players can also practice their swing on the driving range.

Players can also customize weather conditions as well as choose from a plethora of camera shots including the "Ball Cam" that follows the ball to its location. Like many golf games, a meter is used to determine the accuracy and the power of the players swing and also features in-game commentary.

Games.Name: Xplora 1: Peter Gabriel's Secret World
Games.Overview:
Xplora 1: Peter Gabriel's Secret World is a multimedia piece by Peter Gabriel, made to promote his 1992 album, Us. It contains information about Gabriel himself, his record label and its artists, other projects, world music and more. The gaming elements include puzzles and treasure hunting.
As the player completes puzzles and accomplishes goals new areas of the CD are unlocked featuring new content for the player to explore, including the ability to remix Peter Gabriel's music videos and joining in on jam sessions.

Games.Name: Yearn2Learn: Peanuts
Games.Overview: Yearn2Learn: Peanuts is edutainment software for kids aged 3 to 10, hosted by Snoopy and the Peanuts gang. It includes a series of independent activities such as a math game, a geography game, a reading game (which consists of animated Peanuts strips), a visual coordination game and an electronic coloring book. The game features full voice-overs explaining every feature in it and also spelling words and locations. Additionally, the game has many "hotspots" which trigger animations, sounds, etc.

Games.Name: Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon
Games.Overview: When King Harkinian vanishes on a mission to save Gamelon, Link takes off to rescue him. But soon Link is also missing, and Zelda must free them both from their evil captors. This action adventure arcade-style game features 70 playfields, including palaces, forests, swamps, and a mysterious fairy pool. An awesome array of 90 amazing character will talk to you in full animation. Confront sword-wielding Stalfos, floating Ghini, dreaded Dodongos, pinching Gohma, and much more. You'll have a blast smashing your enemies into utter disgrace!

Games.Name: Zelda's Adventure
Games.Overview: As the brave warrior, Princess Zelda, it's your mission to thwart the enemy, Gannon, who has captured Link and taken over Tolemac. On the way to freeing Link, you'll journey deep into the Seven Shrines of the Underworld. You will acquire powerful weapons as you fight evil characters in your attempt to restore the Age of Lightness to this magical land.

Games.Name: Zenith
Games.Overview: Zenith is a pinball game. Controlling the flippers at the bottom of the machine the player has to keep the ball in play. There are many bonuses and specials to be gained such as extra balls, shields, fly mode and low gravity. The player must be on the lookout for acid that can destroy the ball. There are six levels and the game allows up to four players to compete.

Games.Name: Zombie Dinos From Planet Zeltoid
Games.Overview: Innocent dinosaurs have become mindless zombies, controlled by the evil Harry the Harrier and his alien Brain Blobs. But all is not lost. Wise-cracking Dexter the Dinodroid has managed to escape, bringing to Earth the incredible Time Machine. His goal: "Let's kick some brain!" Travel back in the Time Machine 200 million years. Locate each dinosaur before the Brain Blobs take control. Stop them from destroying unsuspecting humans in your hometown. Dexter will help you, along with the Time Machine's invaluable Dino Encyclopedia containing everything you need to know to save the planet.

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Zombie Dinos van de Planeet Zeltoid
